summary: This bill, H.R. 1819, seeks to authorize the President to award the Medal of Honor to E. Royce Williams, a Navy lieutenant, for his actions during the Korean War on November 18, 1952.  Williams, flying an F9F-5 Panther, engaged seven Soviet MiG-15s, shooting down four or five, despite being outnumbered and in a mechanically compromised aircraft. The bill includes findings detailing Williams’ heroism and the historical context, and waives time limitations to allow for the award.
